most_active_tickets.title: Discord link provided is invalid on the website
Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
No response to chat. It just keeps loading .
Discord link provided is invalid in Pieces OS
Sublime Text plugin icon is bogus
MacOS Desktop periodically jumps to main monitor & grabs focus off of current window
copy button in pieces vs code extension keeps loading indefinitely.

common_issues.title: Pieces software bugs across platforms
common_issues.description: Users report various bugs: Pieces crashing on Chrome with large content, VS Code extension copy button endlessly loading, and invalid Discord link on the website.  These issues span desktop, web, and VS Code extension, impacting Windows users primarily.  Suggested solutions include optimizing Pieces for large content, fixing the VS Code extension's copy functionality, and updating the Discord link on the website and documentation.

related_issues.title: Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
related_issues.text:
Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.0

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. Start Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers and use them as normal.
2. Open a tab with a large amount of content. In my case, it was a GitLab CI job with a 6k line job log. I also experienced crashes with ArgoCD when having 100+ apps on a page.
3. Both Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers crash. There are no corresponding log records in the Support directory, only logs about application startup.

Sometimes it freezes Chrome completely.

I have 16GB RAM, 12 vCPU, and have never experienced such behavior without Pieces.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copy button keeps loading forever. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd302f52-5374-4f54-b9f3-a5b260906a72)

related_issues.title: Discord link provided is invalid on the website
related_issues.text:
Discord link provided is invalid on the website
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Marketing Site (pieces.app)

### Operating System / Platform

Web

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The main Pieces website [page](<https://pieces.app>) offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.gg/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/106f7b8e-0f74-4efa-a6ec-9cfe48133198)

The support [page](<https://docs.pieces.app/products/support>) of Pieces documentation website offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.com/invite/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87064aff-9a18-420f-bb9f-a86e358e3dea)

Both of the above Discord invite links are invalid. You should create one without an expiration date and replace all those.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS: Loading issues and invalid Discord link
common_issues.description: Users report infinite loading in chat (GPT 4.1) and VS Code extension's copy button.  One report notes an invalid Discord link in Pieces OS.  Check for connectivity issues, extension conflicts, and verify the Discord link's validity. Update Pieces OS and related extensions to the latest versions.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs Across Platforms
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with the Pieces desktop application, including unexpected window focus changes on macOS, crashes on Windows when Chrome tabs have extensive content, and incorrect plugin icons.  Troubleshooting included reinstallation, process monitoring, and verifying resource usage. Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and implement fixes across different operating systems and versions.

related_issues.title: MacOS Desktop periodically jumps to main monitor & grabs focus off of current window
related_issues.text:
MacOS Desktop periodically jumps to main monitor & grabs focus off of current window
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Just attempted reinstall, will see if that clears it up. Looks like it spawned an extra process which might be what's tripping it. So far it hasn't jumped back up, so we might be clear.

i grabbed a trace of the behavior, reach out on Pieces discord if u want a copy

related_issues.title: Sublime Text plugin icon is bogus
related_issues.text:
Sublime Text plugin icon is bogus
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The Connected Applications menu in Settings uses Pieces icon for Sublime Plugin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6a6d4db1-3767-43cf-a15a-d16a88a0e9a2)

It should be using the Sublime Text 4 icon, since that is what you have published the plugin for.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Discord link issue across website and Pieces OS due to high activity and impact on community engagement.
Investigate and address the Pieces crash on Chrome with large content, focusing on Windows users, to improve stability.
Troubleshoot the VS Code extension's copy button loading issue and the unresponsive chat with GPT 4.1 to enhance user experience.
Review and correct the Sublime Text plugin icon in the Connected Applications menu for visual consistency.
Investigate the macOS desktop focus issue to minimize disruption to user workflow.
Proactively monitor support channels for emerging trends and prioritize issues based on frequency and activity level to improve response times and user satisfaction.
Consider adding more detailed logging to Pieces OS and related components to aid in debugging and faster resolution of issues.
Implement automated testing for common user workflows to catch regressions and ensure software stability across platforms and versions.
Create a dedicated internal knowledge base or FAQ document for common support issues to streamline the troubleshooting process for support agents and users.
Collect user feedback on resolved issues to measure satisfaction and identify areas for further improvement in the support process and product functionality.
Analyze the categories breakdown to identify areas with high pending tickets and allocate resources accordingly to reduce backlog and improve resolution times.
Regularly review and update documentation to ensure accuracy and address common user questions and issues proactively.
Implement a system for tracking and categorizing support tickets to identify recurring issues and prioritize development efforts.
Provide support agents with access to relevant tools and resources to diagnose and resolve issues efficiently.
Encourage users to submit detailed bug reports with steps to reproduce issues to facilitate faster troubleshooting and resolution.
Establish service level agreements (SLAs) for different types of support requests to manage user expectations and ensure timely resolution.
Regularly communicate with users about known issues, planned maintenance, and updates to maintain transparency and build trust.
Offer multiple support channels (e.g., email, chat, community forum) to cater to different user preferences and needs.
Train support agents on effective communication and problem-solving skills to enhance user satisfaction.
Continuously evaluate and improve support processes based on user feedback and performance metrics to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.
Develop a process for escalating complex issues to the appropriate development teams to ensure timely resolution.
Implement a system for tracking and analyzing support metrics (e.g., resolution time, customer satisfaction) to identify areas for improvement and measure the effectiveness of support operations.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team to encourage innovation and enhance the overall user experience.
Regularly review and update support documentation and training materials to ensure they are up-to-date and relevant.
Encourage collaboration between support and development teams to facilitate faster resolution of issues and improve product quality.
Implement a system for proactively identifying and addressing potential issues before they impact users.
Use automation tools to streamline support processes and reduce manual effort.
Provide support agents with regular training and development opportunities to enhance their skills and knowledge.
Encourage users to provide feedback on the support experience to identify areas for improvement.
Regularly review and update support policies and procedures to ensure they are aligned with best practices and meet user needs.
Communicate clearly and effectively with users throughout the support process to manage expectations and build trust.
Empower support agents to resolve issues independently to improve efficiency and user satisfaction.
Foster a positive and supportive work environment for the support team to promote morale and productivity.

Use data-driven insights to inform support strategies and decision-making.
Collaborate with other teams (e.g., product, engineering) to address systemic issues and improve the overall user experience.
Proactively identify and address potential support issues before they escalate.

Regularly assess the effectiveness of the support strategy and make adjustments as needed.
Stay up-to-date on industry best practices and emerging trends in customer support.

Build a strong and supportive community around the product to encourage peer-to-peer support and knowledge sharing.
Encourage users to submit feature requests and provide feedback on the product to inform product development and improve user satisfaction.
Continuously strive to exceed user expectations and provide exceptional customer support.
Recognize and reward support agents for their contributions to improve morale and motivation.
Celebrate successes and learn from failures to foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team.
Prioritize user satisfaction and make it a core value of the support organization.
Build a customer-centric culture that values feedback and strives to provide exceptional support experiences.
Empower users to self-serve through comprehensive documentation, FAQs, and online resources.
Proactively engage with users through social media and other channels to build relationships and address their needs.
Continuously seek ways to improve the support experience and make it easier for users to get the help they need.
